刚才在Reddit关于留学生间谍的主题下被英文小粉红翻出我这篇文章:


Guy is some kind of Japanese nationalist and genocide denier. Supporting idiots like this only discredits your points.

"Manchu in my writing was NOT a Japanese colony "

"they have fabricated some crucial evidence to support their Yangzhou Massacre and Nanjing massacre claim"


我的回应：

Dear Chinese nationalist, you seem to have issues with my Apple Daily publication:

https://tw.appledaily.com/new/realtime/20190513/1565678/

As explained in this analysis,


  1. China-centered history describes Manchu, as well as Tibet and East Turkestan, as a Chinese land and Manchus part of Chinese history. However, third-party scholars reject this racist historical revisionism and Mark Elliot from Harvard is one of them. In this respect, Manchu was not a Japanese colony in WWII more than it had been a Chinese one before and after then.


  2. Ruthless killings did happen in the Japanese invasion of Nanjing, and there is confirmed evidence about them, but in the mean time, as Wikipedia says, "photographs, for instance, which are known to be fabricated, or from different areas and different times, continue to be used to prove Japanese guilt in the winter of 1937–38." By doing this, Chinese nationalists weaponize history to justify jingoism and silence criticism.



I applaud your loyal service to your country. But there's an FBI warrant and that can't be changed by assassination of my character.

以政治正确为武器，通过断章取义进行人格谋杀可以很方便的混淆视听，而且最重要的是这样可以很方便的”征用“你的大量时间。
